transportAdvice: Providenciales has no formal public transit system, so most visitors rely on taxis or rental cars to get around; the island is too spread out for practical walking between attractions. Taxis are widely available at the airport and major resorts, and renting a car is a popular option for exploring beyond Grace Bay.

weather.description: Warm and sunny with low humidity and gentle trade winds, making it one of the most pleasant months to visit.
Dry and comfortable with clear skies and calm seas, ideal for snorkeling and beach activities.
Temperatures begin to rise slightly but conditions remain dry and breezy, excellent for water sports.
Warm and mostly dry with long sunny days and good visibility for diving and snorkeling.
Heat builds and occasional showers begin to appear, though sunny spells still dominate most days.
The start of hurricane season brings higher humidity and more frequent afternoon showers alongside warm temperatures.
Hot and humid with periodic rain showers, though many days remain sunny and the sea is very warm.
Peak hurricane season brings the highest chance of storms and heavy rain, with intense heat and humidity.
The most active month of hurricane season with frequent rain and the greatest risk of tropical weather disruptions.
Hurricane risk begins to ease but showers remain common and humidity stays high through the month.
Conditions gradually improve with lower humidity and fewer rain events as the dry season approaches.
Dry, sunny, and comfortably warm with trade winds returning, marking the beginning of peak tourist season.
